content.description:
Climb the dike past some balancy sections to it's end, continue up a section of tricky face (crux) and finish in a 20' handcrack; lower-off from anchors.

Almost a sport route, but you'll most likely want a piece or two for the crack finish.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the wall just left of

Mercury Landing

and easily identified as a right-slanting dike system.

content.description:
Fun, easy climbing up plates and jugs lead to a roof (crux) which is powered over on good holds to reach anchors a bit higher.

Fun

moves and great scenery make this an area classic.
content.location:
This is the right-most route on the wall and lies just to the right of

Rebel Rebel

, a shorter bolted face.

climbs.name: Rebel Rebel
climbs.fa: Neil Hightower, Eric Sorenson & Steve Gomez, March 2004

content.description: Climb the face using the many jugs, flakes and bomber holds which pepper this route - fun! It looks like the climb could be extended further, albeit at a more difficult grade.
content.location:
This is the second route from the right and lies between

Mercury Landing

on the left and

Spiders from Mars

on the right.

content.description: Start up the corner blocks to the left side of the first bolt. Can place small/medium cam to protect start to the first bolt. Follow the shallow arete to the anchors of Rebel Rebel.
content.protection: 5 bolts, optional small/medium cam for start.
content.location: To the left of Rebel Rebel.

climbs.name: Mercury Landing
climbs.fa: Neil Hightower, Eric Sorenson & Steve Gomez, March 2004

content.description: Technical and balancy moves along a steep slab/face will see you through the crux, which eases higher to fun moves over a small roof with big holds. Much better than it looks and well worth doing if in the area.
content.protection: 8 bolts, bolted anchors (can TR from the anchors on WTPF)
content.location:
This is the second route from the left and lies between

Welcome to Planet M.F.

on the left and

Rebel Rebel

on the right.

content.description: The crux comes high on the route--if you dare to go that far.  Crunchy choss flakes and grit mark most of the key moves on this pile of junk.  In no way does this deserve any stars.
content.protection: Sport bolted lower down, trad gear above (a couple of cams up to 3" should do)  Safe.  Hideous.
content.location: Start up "Welcome to Plant M'F'ers" and cut left at the 4th bolt.  You'll see the rotten rock from the first moves--all the evidence you need to stay away.

content.description: Surmount the slight overhang after clipping bolt 2. Continue on unique facing patina to the anchors.
